channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Was wrong about Donald Trump': JD Vance on once comparing running mate to Hitler
item.description: Ohio Senator JD Vance acknowledged his past criticisms of Donald Trump, now serving as Trump's running mate. He admitted to being wrong, citing Trump's achievements during his presidency and emphasised the importance of honesty and a desire to improve governance moving forward.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Knucklehead at times': Tim Walz says 'misspoke' on claim of being in Hong Kong during Tiananmen Square protests
item.description: Minnesota governor Tim Walz faced scrutiny for inaccurate claims about being in Hong Kong during the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests. Reports reveal he was in Nebraska at the time. Admitting his mistake, Walz clarified he only arrived in China that summer. He acknowledged the error, attributing it to getting caught up in rhetoric.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Middle East crisis: Walz blames Trump’s 'fickle leadership', Vance says he ensured 'stability' at vice presidential debate
item.description: The vice-presidential debate centered on the Middle East crisis, with Democrat Tim Walz advocating for leadership and diplomacy, while Republican JD Vance supported an aggressive deterrence strategy. Walz credited the Biden administration for steady leadership, whereas Vance criticised them for unfreezing Iranian assets. Both provided distinct visions for US foreign policy amid escalating tensions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: In video: Israeli sky turn into fiery battle zone after Iran launches over 100 missiles
item.description: Iran launched 180 missiles at Israel, causing minor damage and few injuries but significant psychological impact. Israel warned of potential escalation and vowed retaliation. The attack escalated ongoing tensions involving Hezbollah and Hamas. The US and international community called for an immediate ceasefire.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indian American business owners support Trump, feels Republican fund-raiser Jiten Agarwal
item.description: Jiten Agarwal, CEO of QuantAi, is hosting a significant reception for Donald Trump in Houston, aiming to raise over $5 million. He emphasized the polarized support for Trump within the Indian American community and critiqued the current administration's policies on foreign affairs and domestic issues.
item.dc:creator: Ishani Duttagupta

item.title: 'Destabilizing, dangerous force in Middle East': What Kamala Harris said about Iran after missile attack on Israel
item.description: Kamala Harris underscores Iran as a destabilizing Middle East force while vowing unyielding support for Israel's security. Her statements follow Iran’s ballistic missile attack on Israel, a response to Israel’s military actions in Lebanon. Tensions rise as international scrutiny grows over Israel’s actions in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bangladesh says keen on good ties with Pakistan but won't forget 1971
item.description: Bangladesh expresses a desire for good relations with Pakistan, contingent on acknowledging and apologizing for the 1971 atrocities. Foreign affairs adviser Md Touhid Hossain clarifies that Bangladesh’s current stance remains unchanged, emphasizing the importance of addressing historical issues for improved diplomatic ties.

item.title: Iran launches 200 missiles at Israel as crisis escalates
item.description: In retaliation to the killings of militant leaders, Iran launched up to 200 missiles at Israel, causing sirens to sound across the nation and injuries in central Israel. Iran's Revolutionary Guards warned of further destructive responses if Israel retaliates. Israeli officials have vowed consequences, asserting plans for their own strategic response.

item.title: P Diddy: Attorney says he has a list of names that will shock public; 120 accusers allege sexual misconduct
item.description: Attorney Tony Buzbee announced that 120 individuals have leveled new sexual misconduct allegations against Sean 'Diddy' Combs, with evidence including pictures, texts, and videos. The allegations include violent sexual assault, facilitated sex with controlled substances, and abuse of minors. Diddy denies the charges and plans to appeal. ​"It’s a long list already, but because of the nature of this case, we are going to make sure, damn sure we are right before we do that. These names will shock you," the attorney said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump says Harris, Biden leading world to the brink of World War III, 'If Kamala gets four more years...'
item.description: ​Trump said when he was the president, Iran was in total check. "They were starved for cash, fully contained, and desperate to make a deal. Kamala flooded them with American cash and, ever since, they've been exporting terror all over, and unravelling the Middle East," Trump's statement said. ​“If I was in charge, October 7th never happens, Russia/Ukraine never happens, Afghanistan Botched Withdrawal never happens, and Inflation never happens. If I win, we will have peace in the World again. If Kamala gets 4 more years, the World goes up in smoke.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump campaign mocks at Kamala Harris' 'don't' message for Iran as Israel comes under attack
item.description: ​"When I was President, Iran was in total check. They were starved for cash, fully contained, and desperate to make a deal. Kamala flooded them with American cash and, ever since, they've been exporting terror all over, and unraveling the Middle East," a statement issued by Donald Trump said. ​Israeli police said that four people were killed in the shooting in Tel Aviv and that an additional seven were injured. Two gunmen were "neutralized" on the scene, the police said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Epstein and Diddy cases not same, says model Lisa Phillips: 'Sean thought he was God'
item.description: "We heard about it, people talked about it… I think he just thought he was God and above all. Nothing was going to happen to him," Epstein accuser Lisa Phillips said. Epstein and Combs ran in very different circles but their modus operandi was he same, she said. ​"Jeffrey was not an open secret. Jeffrey was all under the table. Only certain people knew about the sex trafficking, He was very smart -- he was much smarter than Sean Combs, much more highly intelligent," Phillips said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Veep debate no laughing matter with lightweights expected to do heavy lifting
item.description: The 1967 adoption of the 25th amendment elevated the US vice-presidency's significance. Currently, Trump and Kamala Harris's running mates, JD Vance and Tim Walz, are set for a pivotal debate. Trump's provocative comments have heightened stakes, while Harris calls for a second presidential debate as the political drama unfolds.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Watch: Shocking close encounter between US and Russian fighter jets near Alaska
item.description: US military officials released a video of a Russian fighter jet flying dangerously close to a US F-16 near Alaska on September 23, 2024. The incident underscores rising tensions as Russian and Chinese military activities intensify in the region, prompting calls for increased US military presence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indian diaspora's cultural impact on America: From cuisine to cricket
What is October surprise Hillary Clinton warns Kamala Harris about?
item.description: "Russians are active in the election, so is Iran, we know. Chinese uses TikTok; they certainly used against Biden and for Trump. I think they're a little less pro-Trump right now. So you look at where people get there information from and they get their information largely from social media. And so the campaign is doing its best job to combat that both domestic and foreign false disinformation," Hillary said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Princess Beatrice is pregnant, expecting her second baby with Mozzi
item.description: ​​The palace said 36-year-old Beatrice and her husband Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi “are very pleased to announce that they are expecting their second child together in early spring.” The baby will be a sibling for 8-year-old Wolfie – Mapello Mozzi’s son from a previous relationship — and the couple’s 3-year-old daughter Sienna.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did people cancel Netflix subscription after chairman's donation to Kamala Harris?
item.description: Shortly after Hastings’ endorsement, fans of Donald Trump began urging people to drop the service. Some posted photos showing they had closed their accounts alongside the hashtag #CancelNetflix. Three days after the endorsement, July 26 was the single worst day for Netflix cancelations this year. After July 29, daily cancellations returned to normal levels and have remained stable since then.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk calls Vinod Khosla 'dumb' in Twitter feud over Argentina’s economy
item.description: Elon Musk and Vinod Khosla clashed over Argentina’s economy, with Musk siding with President Javier Milei’s policies. Khosla's incorrect unemployment figure led to a heated exchange, further fueled by media highlighting Argentina's rising poverty under Milei.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Disabled UK journalist forced to crawl to flight bathroom as there's no wheelchair: 'Wow. It’s 2024 and...'
item.description: LOT Polish Airlines did not have any wheelchair on board as it's not their policy. BBC war correspondent Frank Gardner who is paralyzed had to crawl on his back to the washroom because of this policy. He posted his photo on X triggering a debate on how inhumane the airline policy is. Gardner, however, said the cabin crew were very helpful and apologetic.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
